questions.question_text: A company has located its computer center on a moderate earthquake fault. Which of the following is the MOST important consideration when establishing a contingency plan and an alternate processing site?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Agree it is A.

Selected Answer: A
Strangely, even if they are valid, I don't see many answers supported by an explanation. In any case, it is evident that in this scenario the most important consideration is to establish the alternative site away from the risk to which the main site is exposed.

choices.B: The contingency plan provides for backup media to be taken to the alternative site.
choices.D: The alternative site is a hot site with equipment ready to resume processing immediately.
choices.C: The contingency plan for high priority applications does not involve a shared cold site.
choices.A: The alternative site does not reside on the same fault no matter how far the distance apart.
